confession.seduction_context: Encountered black man twice - first when her brother-in-law was ill and causing disorders, then around St Jean when going to market at Bruyeres. He offered to help her in disputes with Jean Creuchat and her brother-in-law over garden boundaries and building, offering money for her needs.

testimony.quarrel_subject: mother and Marie (sister) taking his fruit from his garden
testimony.threat_quote: talked of need to empty house and burn them

testimony.quarrel_subject: refused to let workers ride on cart to hay meadow
refused to plough a field for her

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: around last St George, after refusing to plough

testimony.quarrel_subject: refused to do ploughing for her
testimony.threat_quote: she told him he might repent

witnesses.name: Didier Marie
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: community member - she helped guard the herd

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute about places at veillée, threatened to expel Marie and Georgette

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 10 years earlier - goats died 2-3 days after being fed apple

testimony.quarrel_subject: asked for payment (10 deniers/1 blanc) for transporting her wheat

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day after asking for payment

testimony.quarrel_subject: several quarrels with Marie over small matters

harms_alleged.target: animals every year - most recently pregnant cow and small bull

testimony.quarrel_subject: sister-in-law from Remiremont had quarrel with Georgette
dispute over payment for load of manure - Georgette offered 1 franc, witness demanded 18 gros

previous winter - immediately after eating cooked apple given by Georgette

timeline.subject: Georgette Brihey
timeline.details: Witness testimonies taken at Bruyeres by prévôt George Milot at request of partie formelle Jean de Cugney

timeline.subject: Georgette Brihey
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses; agreed to visiting Didier Mengin's cow but denied harming or healing it; denied all significant charges

timeline.subject: Georgette Brihey
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Georgette Brihey
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews, rack, and strappado with 25-30 pound stone; denied being witch, called on saints for help

timeline.subject: Georgette Brihey
timeline.details: Confessed to encounters with black man named Jaulne; refused to confess to malefices despite pressure

timeline.subject: Georgette Brihey
timeline.details: Expanded confession about evil spirit named Poirson; renounced God and church but refused to renounce family

timeline.subject: Georgette Brihey
timeline.details: Confirmed earlier statements but would add nothing; denied knowing if sister Marie was a witch

timeline.subject: Georgette Brihey
timeline.details: PG des Vosges suggests she is sufficiently condemned by own confession and asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Georgette Brihey
timeline.details: Change de Nancy orders reiteration of torture

methods: strappado with 25-30 pound stone attached to legs
torture.restrictions: question ordinaire et extraordinaire approved; later reiteration ordered

prior_accusations.context: Multiple witnesses testified to widespread and long-standing reputation as witch, as were her mother and sister Marie. Reputation went back at least 15 years.

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie and Georgette Brihey
notable_quotes.french: Arrier mauvais, arrier, nous n'avons que faire de toy icy
notable_quotes.english: Away evil, away, we have nothing to do with you here
notable_quotes.context: Said to sick daughter of Jacot Doron while placing scarf over her eyes

notable_quotes.speaker: Jannon veuve Jean Tiriot (reporting Marie and Georgette)
notable_quotes.french: t'arrier mauvais, que le bon vienne icy
notable_quotes.english: Away evil, let the good come here
notable_quotes.context: Alternative account of words spoken to Jacot Doron's dying child

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie Brihey
notable_quotes.context: After cutting off end of hen's tail and throwing it to sick child

notable_quotes.speaker: Pierat Colas Pierat (describing sisters' behavior)
notable_quotes.context: Describing Marie and Georgette's behavior at veillée dispute

notable_quotes.speaker: Adeline veuve Colin Cugney (quoting Georgette)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle ne vouloit pas tant de paroles
notable_quotes.english: that she did not want so many words
notable_quotes.context: Georgette's comment when finally agreeing to pay 18 gros for manure

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgette Brihey (to mother of sick girl)
notable_quotes.french: luy deffendit d'en parler, crainte de pire
notable_quotes.english: forbade her to speak of it, for fear of worse
notable_quotes.context: Mother's response when daughter told her about illness after eating Georgette's apple

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgette Brihey (to Jean Creuchat)
notable_quotes.english: that he would get quartan fever
notable_quotes.context: Her angry words about neighbor in garden boundary dispute

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgette Brihey (confession)
notable_quotes.french: alors elle entra en creance que ce n'estoit chose qui vaille, et en eust tant d'apprehension et scrupule, que n'osant s'en deceler au sieur son curé, elle proposa en elle mesme et resouldit d'en conferer à la premiere occasion avec quelque bon pere minime du couvent d'Espinal
notable_quotes.english: then she came to believe that this was not a good thing, and had so much apprehension and scruple about it, that not daring to reveal it to her priest, she proposed to herself and resolved to confer about it at the first occasion with some good Minim father from the convent at Espinal
notable_quotes.context: Her account of her reaction after encountering the devil, showing she recognized it was evil but never followed through on consulting a priest

notable_quotes.speaker: Devil (Poirson/Jaulne) to Georgette
notable_quotes.french: il ne la laisseroit jamais, et feroit qu'en tout et par tout elle prevadroit contre ses haineux, mesme luy fourniroit argent pour ses necessitez
notable_quotes.english: he would never leave her, and would ensure that in all things and everywhere she would prevail against her enemies, and would even provide her money for her needs
notable_quotes.context: Devil's promise when trying to get her to give herself to him

relationships.evidence_text: suspicion against her, as against mother and sister
suspicion against her, as against mother and sister
when her brother-in-law was ill and out of his wits
difficulties with Jean Creuchat over the sharing and division of their adjoining gardens
When he suggested to his wife
story of his sister's illness 15 years back
when she told her mother what had happened

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over payment for services: Georgette disputed payment for manure (wanted to pay 1 franc, forced to pay 18 gros); Curien Coitoux asked for payment (10 deniers/1 blanc) for transporting wheat. Major property dispute with Jean Creuchat over garden boundary - masons were to build wall giving him extra foot of land and build oven. Also dispute with brother-in-law over hay garden boundary and posts. Devil offered her money for her needs, highlighting financial difficulties. She told devil she did not have enough money to maintain her own house.

harms_catalog.harm_description: cow fell ill, would not eat for fortnight, so sick he would have taken a sol for it; recovered after Georgette said it had fine eyes and would recover
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: angry because mother and Marie were taking his fruit
harms_catalog.method_alleged: visited cow and said it would recover

harms_catalog.harm_description: cart upset twice for no apparent reason
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused to let workers ride on cart to meadow

harms_catalog.harm_description: was so frightened that had to be helped home, and was ill for a long time afterwards
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witnessing Marie and Georgette performing ritual on sick child

harms_catalog.harm_description: small daughter sick, possibly at point of death according to another witness
harms_catalog.attributed_to: unclear - Marie and Georgette were treating/exorcising

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused to plough a field for her

harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 10 years earlier - one goat died 2 days later, other lost 3 days then died
harms_catalog.method_alleged: poisoned apple - gave large apple to his child saying child should not eat it but was for father; cut up and fed to goats

harms_catalog.harm_description: sick cow which seemed to be improving died unexpectedly next day
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: asked for payment (10 deniers/1 blanc) for transporting her wheat from Bruyeres

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost animals every year for 8 years, most recently pregnant cow and small bull
harms_catalog.attributed_to: witchcraft - suspected those at Bruyeres (Georgette and Marie)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: several quarrels with Marie over small matters

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost many animals without knowing cause

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: had quarrel with Georgette, who was already suspected

harms_catalog.harm_description: first cow to enter stable became sick, still sick at testimony
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute over payment for load of manure - Georgette wanted to pay 1 franc, witness demanded 18 gros
refused Georgette some bread at veillée

harms_catalog.harm_description: horse broke its thigh in stable and had to be destroyed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: none - but two foals had escaped into their garden and were brought back by Georgette

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill immediately after eating cooked apple, lasted 3 weeks
harms_catalog.method_alleged: poisoned apple - gave her cooked apple while spinning at common poisle

economic_hardship_indicators: Georgette told devil she did not have enough money to maintain her own house
Devil offered to lend her money and provide for her needs
Multiple payment disputes over small amounts
Animals had significant economic value - cow so sick worth only a sol

hearsay_chains.content: bull took sick when passing Georgette's house
mother forbade her to speak of illness from apple for fear of worse

emotional_state_notes: During torture called on patron saint St George, St Nicolas, God and the Virgin for help
Said mother had paid her very ill for way she had cared for and supported her so long
Showed apprehension and scrupule about devil encounter, intended to confess to priest but never did
Refused to confess to malefices despite pressure

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Agreed to visiting Didier Mengin's cow which she had previously denied, but said she had neither harmed nor healed it
Said when she was seen out at night was looking for a shirt they had lost

third_parties.name: Marie Brihey
third_parties.context: Sister also suspected of witchcraft; participated in treating sick child; involved in multiple quarrels; seen with Georgette at night by stream; Georgette denied knowing if she was witch

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete 5-page trial record with detailed witness testimony, torture sequence, and confession. Georgette confessed under torture to encounters with devil (named Jaulne/Poirson) who offered help with property disputes and money, but she refused to confess to any maleficia. Sentenced to death despite maintaining innocence of actual harmful acts. Notable for family reputation (mother and sister also suspected), extensive property/payment disputes, and her stated intention to consult priest about devil encounter which she never followed through on. Rich detail on social interactions, economic disputes, and community tensions.
